Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.http

Class HTTPReader

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.http.HTTPReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Reader<HTTPPacket>
public class HTTPReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reader<HTTPPacket>
Reader used to read an HTTPPacket that can either be a request or a response.

    Processes the buffer and read every lines until an HTTP component can be created.
    void reset()
    Resets the reader to its initial state.
    Note that the packet will not be accessible with get() until process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.

  • Constructor Details

    • HTTPReader

  • Method Details

    • process

      public Reader.ProcessStatus process​(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
      Processes the buffer and read every lines until an HTTP component can be created. (i.e. if it's an HTTP response read until empty line and if it's an HTTP request read the first line only) This method remembers what has been processed beforehand. The returned value can be :
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.REFILL : if the reader has not finished.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE : if the message is ready to be get.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.ERROR :
        • If the first line doesn't starts with 'HTTP' nor 'GET'.
        • If the first line starts with 'GET' but doesn't ends with 'HTTP/1.1'.
        • If this is a response but the size is negative or above ChatOSUtils.BUFFER_MAX_SIZE.
        • If this is a response but the size is not in the header (i.e. there's no field "Content-Length").
      Specified by:
      process in interface Reader<HTTPPacket>
      Parameters:
      bb - the buffer where to read the data. Must be in write-mode before being called and will be kept in write-mode after.
      Returns:
      the current state of this reader.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if bb is null.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the reader has already finished reading data. (i.e. already returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE)

    • get

      public HTTPPacket get()
      Specified by:
      get in interface Reader<HTTPPacket>
      Returns:
      the packet if the process(ByteBuffer) method has successfully read a packet. The returned packet has a new buffer for each call of this method.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the process method hasn't finished to read a packet.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the reader to its initial state.
      Note that the packet will not be accessible with get() until process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Reader<HTTPPacket>
